articles.author: Jefferson Graham
articles.title: Amazon's Ring purchase: Get ready for Alexa to greet you at the doorstep
articles.description: Imagine asking Alexa if your child has arrived home while you're upstairs, or at work.

articles.author: Reuters Editorial
articles.title: Russia's Gazprom says has started terminating gas contracts with Ukraine
articles.description: Russia's gas giant Gazprom (GAZP.MM) said on Saturday it had started moves to terminate gas supply contracts with Ukraine's Naftogaz, though Kiev said there had so far been no impact on supplies through its pipelines to Europe.

articles.author: Reuters Editorial
articles.title: US prosecutors want stay lifted to settle 'The Wolf of Wall Street' suit
articles.description: The U.S. Justice Department has asked a court to lift a stay on civil proceedings linked to a Malaysian fund at the center of its biggest ever "kleptocracy" probe, so that a settlement can be reached with producers of the movie 'The Wolf of Wall Street'.

articles.title: Malaysia Says Search for Missing Plane to End in June

articles.author: Jillian Ambrose
articles.title: Perfect storm for energy supplies as UK runs on empty
Shortly before Trump announced tariffs, his former adviser dumped millions in steel-related stocks
articles.description: Carl Icahn sold his $31.3 million stake in the Manitowoc Company, a leading manufacturer of cranes. Since Trump’s announcement, Manitowoc’s stock has plummeted.

articles.author: Anjani Trivedi
articles.title: Chinese Conglomerate HNA Gets a Lifeline
articles.description: As Beijing takes on its heavily indebted private companies, China’s HNA Group Co. is quietly getting a helping hand.

articles.author: Joan Gralla
articles.title: Storm causes delays, suspensions on LIRR, Amtrak, officials say
articles.description: Both the Long Island Rail Road and Amtrak said they were forced to suspend some service because of problems caused by Friday’s nor’easter. Amtrak stopped running trains between Boston and Washington,

articles.author: By Jim Puzzanghera and James Rufus Koren
articles.title: Fed chief: Wells Fargo needs 'significant' reforms before cap is lifted
articles.description:
The new chief of the Federal Reserve said this week that a cap it placed on the growth of Wells Fargo & Co. after widespread consumer abuses would not be easily lifted - but the bank would not have to fully implement reform plans before it was removed.

articles.title: Bitcoin heist: 600 powerful computers stolen in Iceland
articles.description: Some 11 people were arrested, including a security guard, in what Icelandic media have dubbed the "Big Bitcoin Heist."

articles.author: William Watts, Neandra Salvaterra
articles.title: Oil ends higher after rig data, but logs weekly loss
articles.description: Oil futures maintains gains to snap a three-session slide after another small rise in the number of U.S. rigs drilling for crude, but suffers a down week.

articles.author: Ross Kerber
articles.title: BlackRock poses tough questions to gunmakers and sellers
articles.description: Asset manager BlackRock Inc said on Friday it is pressing gunmakers and weapons retailers in its portfolios to explain how they monitor firearm sales and use, and it is studying the creation of new index-based portfolios of stocks that would exclude gunmakers…

articles.title: Harley-Davidson Invests In California Electric Motorcycle Company, Alta Motors
articles.description: The move by the Milwaukee-based Harley-Davidson is the latest in efforts to become a global leader in electric motorcycles.

articles.title: Instead of Taking on Gun Control, Democrats Are Teaming With Republicans for a Stealth Attack on Wall Street Reform
articles.description: A bill that began as a well-intentioned effort to satisfy community bank grievances has instead sparked fears that Washington is paving the way for the next financial meltdown.

articles.author: Kate Taylor
articles.title: LL Bean has raised the minimum age to buy a gun — and it's part of a trend that's sweeping the industry
articles.description: L.L. Bean has followed the lead of Walmart and Dick's Sporting Goods and raised its minimum age for gun sales to 21.
